sub_title: Experienced CEO looking for a new opportunity
summary:
International experienced CEO and Managing Director. Holding those positions over an 18 year period (2003/2021) at mid-size companies of 'The Bama business', mostly based in Germany, but also in many other European countries (e.g. Netherlands, Poland)`. Full P&L and Functional responsibility (e.g. Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain, Finance, HR) for most European markets/ countries. CEO position fulfilled both in standalone organization(s) as well as in international Global Matrix Organization(s) at Fast Moving Consumer Good (FMCG) US based companies Sara Lee resp. SC Johnson and German based private equity Serafin. In the role of CEO also part of the Board for the German Business (Sara Lee) resp. Member of European Lead Team with Headquarters in Switzerland (SC Johnson).

Industry experience mostly with manufacturing & distribution of branded products (but also Private Label) trough out Europe (e.g. Germany, France, Benelux, Austria, Switzerland, Spain, Poland) in the Shoe retail channel, Hyper & Supermarkets and Drugstores (e.g. Carrefour, Auchan, Intermarche, Rewe, Edeka, Kaufland, Rossmann, DM, Albert Heijn) but also in the Hard Discount channel (e.g. Aldi, Lidl). 

Proven trackrecord for management of ``high performance`` organization(s)
- Achievement of strong accelerated sales growth via mix of new innovative products, brand development and professionalized 'true service company'. This allowed for both strong sales growth at existing customer base as well acquisition of new customers, but also new channels and countries. 
- Achievement of high (synergy) cost savings by e.g. the integration of businesses (drive scale advantages). 

Wide experience in the integration of businesses in many (European) countries with subsequent close down of legal entities, separation of staff (covered by social plan), closure/ relocation of factories.

Broad M&A experience, both with acquisitions as well as divestments of businesses via equity and or asset deals.  In CEO postion worked in close cooperation with Corporate (M&A, legal ) officers and London based investment bankers (e.g. Goldman Sachs, Stamford) a.o with Data room, Due dilligence process, draft and do managemenet presentations to potential buyers, TSA agreements, Market share data for Anti-trust Board

Strong background and experience in Finance area. Holding positions over an 21 year period (1981/2002) as CFO and Certified Public Auditor (Second in Command to Vice president Internal Audit Sara Lee International and Senior director at Ernst & Young) at international companies and in a wide set of industries.

Net Revenue € 50 Mio / 150 FTE / Brands Bama, Salamander, Woly, Tana.  Shareholder SERAFIN Unternehmensgruppe.

With SERAFIN as a new shareholder, I continued in my position as CEO and MD for the commercial business of the Bama group, which initially comprised the business in the shoe retail channel (and hard discount channel). The business needed to be 'carved out' from the SC Johnson organization and become (overtime) a fully standalone business. For the transformation period TSA agreements were concluded.

Projects & Achievements
- Smooth transition of the business (mix of equity and asset deal), successful carve out for all the various rendered services. No business interruption and cost effective alternatives implemented. 
- Together with an external advisory company a plan was (further) developed for the future supply chain resp. warehouse/ logistic organization and location. The plan has been implemented in the years 2021/ 2022.
- Start with the implementation of the business plan (which was part of the management presentations to potential buyers) which amongst others included the 'repair' (roll back) of decisions taken in the Centralized SC Johnson organization, which were not beneficial for the Niche business in the shoe retail channel. Subsequent to repair of the challenges and turn around activities, the plan included again an accelerated growth of Sales and Profits
- Strong Profits (ahead plan) during the first half year being part of the Serafin group. Sales and Profit behind plan during spring/summer season, following the strong decline of the ``shoe retail market`` during that season.", 'title': 'Chief Executive Officer / MD', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 4039, 'name': 'SC Johnson', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE7Ys54G3BpgQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1618669602716?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=0Rf2V-fqysS5iv5f-Ve1ZUd47GEwunvi7HfcOVku5yY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/scjohnson/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'SC Johnson', 'description': 'S.C. Johnson & Son, Inc in USA.

I continued in my position as CEO and MD for the Bama business.  The first two years was business as ususal, but subsequent years with `transformation of the business and shift of Responsibilities to SC Johnson Standards, Structures & Strategies. Next to my CEO position, I also was a member of the Europen Lead Team for total SC Johnson business in Europe.

The new SC Johnson strategy did not work well for the shoecare category, but especially not for the nishe business in the shoe retail channel. Corporate Management finally decided in 2017 to spinn of the shoe retail business.

Projects & Achievements
- Successful transition and integration of the business from Sara Lee into the SC Johnson organization.
- In view of the spin-off process for the shoe retail business, a solution needed to be found for the shoe care business (Kiwi brand) in the hyper and supermarket channel in France and Germany. Since SC Johnson could not manage locally the "route to market model" , I succesfully searched for alternatives and negotiated distributors agreements on which basis,  the business was success fully handed over to local SC Johnson commercial organizations in both countries
- Key role in the divestment process of the shoe retail business (e.g. information data room, vendor due diligence audit process, support of investments bankers (Stamford, London) with drafting of documents, to support the sale process, drafting of management presentation and subsequently do presentations to potential buyers. Support investments bankers and SC Johnson Corporate officers in the sale negotiation process and drafting of Transition Service (TSA) agreements. The shoe retail business was sold successfully to Serafin group (Private Equity)', 'title': 'Chief Executive Officer / MD', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Melvo GmbH en Holding', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Melvo GmbH en Holding', 'description': 'Melvo GmbH and Melvo Holding GmbH/ Ludwigsburg-Germany / Marketing, Sale, Distribution & Manufacturing of Shoe care, insoles & accessories products / Net Revenue € 40 Mio / 150 FTE / Brands: Salamander, Woly.

In 2014 by means of M&A share deal(s) by SC Johnson Bama GmbH, the Melvo business was acquired. Next to my position as CEO for SC Johnson Bama GmbH, I was also, in parralel,  the CEO and MD for the Melvo companies. The Melvo group included legal entities (and its own local sales team) in Russia, Germany, France, India, but also served distributors in many other countries in Europe and beyond

Projects & Achievements
- I was one of the key players in the due diligence process for the acquisition of the Melvo business, which deal was completed by the M&A team of SC Johnson in USA.
- Successful integration (marketing, sales, customer service, Finance, IT, HR) of the Melvo business in Europe into the SC Johnson Bama organization (Melvo business in Russia was integrated in SC Johnson Russia) and achievement of considerable synergy cost savings ( > € 1 Mio for European business only).
- As MD of the Melvo business/ legal entities, I played a key role together with a few other SC Johnson disciplines, in the successful Close down of the Melvo factory, warehouse/logistic center and offices in Ludwigsburg (including lay off 120 FTEs covered by a Social plan). Manufacturing of Melvo products was moved to various other SC Johnson factories in Europe and a third party logistic provider in Poland. Huge synergie cost savings (> € 3 Mio).
- I successfully negotiated and completed a deal for a Management buy-out (by MD of Melvo India) for the Melvo business/ legal entity in India. Next to shoe retail customers in Europe and beyond, the Bama organization also covered the shoe care business in the Super & Hypermarket channel in Germany France, Netherlands and Belgium. Also the business covered shoe care products sold in Europe via Hard discount chains.

In 2009 Sara Lee decided to spinn of the Household and Body care Divison of which the Bama business was part.  In view of this process the Bama organisation became additional responsibilities and I played a key role togather with the investment bankers (Goldman Sachs, London) in the sales process
	
Projects and Achievements
- Successful integration of shoe retail business from many European countries into one centrally organized Pan European business. No business lost and huge cost synergies (> € 2 Mio).

A Return On Sales (EBITDA) was achieved of 12 to 15%
- Succesfull interim management Distributors Eastern Europe (Super & Hypermarkets)

The CFO position covered the Strategic and Operative management of the departments: Finance (Accounting and Financial reporting), Treasury, Financial Controlling, IT and HR as well as parts of Supply-Chain. Oversight/ Responsibility for 50 FTE.

Projects & Achievements
- Smooth integration and upgrade of the Finance organization from standards from a locally owned family business into the standards of multinational Sara Lee (e.g. monthly reporting format, procedures, internal control systems).
- Smooth integration of the local German shoe retail company of Sara Lee in the newly acquired Bama company. - Double role as CFO and representation of CEO (who became new duties within Sara Lee group) for a period of more than one year, finally honored with promotion as CEO.
